required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Aging and Gender-Affirming Hormone Therapy on Vascular Endothelial Function and Metabolic Profiles in Transgender Women
clinical_study.official_title: Novel Evaluations of Aging and Gender-Affirming Hormone Therapy on Vascular Endothelial Function and Metabolic Profiles in Transgender Women Compared to Age Group-Matched Cisgender Adults

brief_summary.textblock: This study will examine markers of vascular endothelial function (vascular health) and metabolic profiles in younger versus older transgender women (people who were assigned male at birth but whose gender identity is female). Data will also be compared to those from cisgender women and men.

primary_outcome.description: Brachial artery flow-mediated dilation (FMD), as measured by ultrasound.

secondary_outcome.description: The carotid artery compliance index indicates how elastic the artery is. The index describes the change in arterial blood volume in response to a change in arterial blood pressure. Lower numbers are associated with worse outcomes (less elastic arteries).

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of carotid artery beta stiffness index
secondary_outcome.description: The carotid artery beta stiffness index indicates how stiff the artery is. Higher numbers are associated with worse outcomes (stiffer artery).

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of oxidant burden: oxidized LDL
secondary_outcome.description: Oxidized low-density lipoprotein (LDL) measured in the blood and endothelial cells.
Nitrotyrosine measured in the blood and endothelial cells.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of vascular endothelial cell inflammation: NFkB
secondary_outcome.description: Protein NFkB (nuclear factor kappa-light-chain-enhancer of activated B cells) measured in blood and endothelial cells.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of vascular endothelial cell inflammation: MCP-1
secondary_outcome.description: Monocyte Chemoattractant Protein-1 (MCP-1) measured in blood and endothelial cells.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of vascular endothelial cell inflammation: IL-6
secondary_outcome.description: Interleukin 6 (IL-6) measured in blood and endothelial cells.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of vascular endothelial cell inflammation: CRP
secondary_outcome.description: C-reactive protein (CRP) measured in blood and endothelial cells.
Total cholesterol will be determined at baseline.
Triglycerides will be determined at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Whole body composition: Percent Lean Mass
secondary_outcome.description: Percent lean mass will be determined using dual energy x-ray absorptiometry.

secondary_outcome.measure: Whole body composition: Percent Fat Mass
secondary_outcome.description: Percent fat mass will be determined using dual energy x-ray absorptiometry.

secondary_outcome.measure: Regional body composition: Percent Lean Mass
secondary_outcome.description: Regional percent lean mass will be determined using dual energy x-ray absorptiometry.

secondary_outcome.measure: Regional body composition: Percent Fat Mass
secondary_outcome.description: Regional percent fat mass will be determined using dual energy x-ray absorptiometry.
Physical activity will me monitored for 7 days with an ActivPALmonitor
Energy intake will be estimated with a 3-day food diary

arm_group.description: This cohort will consist of transgender women aged 50-75 years old who have taken estradiol and spironolactone for at least one year.
This cohort will consist of transgender women aged 18-40 years old who have taken estradiol and spironolactone for at least one year.

study_pop.textblock: Transgender women from the Denver metropolitan area and/or who utilize health care at University of Colorado Hospital.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Aged 18-40 years old or 50-75 years old
- Identify as a transgender woman
- Have taken estradiol and spironolactone for at least one year
- Currently taking oral or transdermal estradiol
Exclusion Criteria:
- Don't identify as a transgender woman
- Not currently taking estradiol or spironolactone
- Have been on estradiol and spironolactone for less than one year
- History of orchiectomy
- Current tobacco smoker
- Current illicit drug use
- History of prior or active estrogen-dependent neoplasms
- Acute liver or gallbladder disease
- Venous thromobembolism
- Hypertriglyceridemia >500 mg/dL
- Fasted plasma glucose >7.0 mmol/L or previously treated diabetes
- Resting blood pressure >140/90 mmHg

eligibility.gender_description: Transgender women (people who were assigned male at birth but whose gender identity is female). They may or may not have legally changed their gender marker.
